articles.author: Katherine Tangalakis-Lippert
articles.title: Listen to the haunting audio of Earth's magnetic field released by the European Space Agency - Business Insider South Africa
articles.description: Loudspeakers at Solbjerg Square in Copenhagen, Denmark, are broadcasting the recording of the crackling and deep breathing-like sounds.
articles.content:
The European Space Agency this week released five minutes of haunting, crackling audio — revealing what Earth's magnetic field sounds like.
Earth's internal magnetism, called the magnetosphere, gene… [+1515 chars]

articles.author: ABC News
articles.title: European Union bans sale of petrol and diesel cars from 2035 to boost electric vehicle uptake - ABC News
articles.description: The European Union strikes a deal to effectively ban the sale of new petrol and diesel cars from 2035, aiming to speed up the switch to electric vehicles and combat climate change.
articles.content:
The European Union has struck a deal on a law to effectively ban the sale of new petrol and diesel cars from 2035, aiming to speed up the switch to electric vehicles and combat climate change.

articles.title: Iran Rejects Call For UN Probe Into Russian Use Of Its Drones In Ukraine War - Radio Free Europe / Radio Liberty
articles.description: Iran has criticized a call by France, Germany, and Britain for the United Nations to investigate accusations that Russia has used Iranian-made drones to attack Ukraine.

articles.author: RFE/RL's Ukrainian Service
articles.title: 'Massive' Russian Strikes Leave Millions In Ukraine Without Power; Russia Orders Kherson Evacuation - Radio Free Europe / Radio Liberty
articles.description: Ukrainian forces shelled Russian positions in the occupied and illegally seized southern Kherson region, targeting Moscow's resupply routes across the Dnieper River in apparent preparation for a full assault on Kherson city.
